text: Have a quick question about the Deals API if anyone knows its' limitations and capabilities. Is it possible to pull specific custom properties associated with a deal? For example we have put product data that deals have been quoted for into HubSpot as a custom property and I'd like to pull reports on that data with with product data associated to it. Is this possible? Not much luck from HubSpot support unfortunately. Thanks

Hi All!

I'm using the API V3 and I'd like to get the Contact's company name.
Is there a property like company_id on the Contacts CRM API?
There is available the "HubSpot_owner_id" to get the Contact's owner ID for example but I didn't find the reference to the company.

What I had to do is to get the Contact's assoctiations:
`/crm/v3/associations/contacts/companies/batch/read` 
and based on the company ID returned I make a new request to
`/crm/v3/objects/companies/{companyId}`

Is that the only one way? Regards

Hi All,

   Can any one help me
It is possible to integrate indeed job posting using api in the HubSpot/ any other CMS ?
Once we filled the form in our website then automatically  indeed job post will create  using api?
this one is possible in he HubSpot or ny other CMS please let me know?

<@U01EWS3UULX> association enpoint will return an association only if you already created it

<@U015RNVUMRA> I don’t understand what you want to do, what is the link between indeed and HubSpot ?
Thanks for your reply <@U01DF3PNCKA> May i know It is possible to integrate the indeed job posting  in the HubSpot site using api?
you want to integrate indeed job posting in your cms ?
yes <@U01DF3PNCKA>
The form is for searching or posting job ?
posting job <@U01DF3PNCKA>
if i filled and submit the form in my cms website after posting job will create in the indeed
Well, this is possible only if indeed api offer you a wayto do it and as far as i remember you can only search job with the api.
oh thank you so much for you help <@U01DF3PNCKA>
I think currently indeed is not provide any api for job posting right? <@U01DF3PNCKA>
as i said , no : <https://opensource.indeedeng.io/api-documentation/>
Thanks a lot <@U01DF3PNCKA>
<@U01DF3PNCKA> is there available the company_id column direct in the contact's object?

There is the associatedcompanyid field (readonly) which is filled only if you create an association : <https://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog/2019-01-24-update-the-associatedcompanyid-contact-property-will-become-read-only-on-april-26th>
And the field company you can use to store the company name
but it will not create automatic association if you use the api
Hey all, can any help me with OneTrust & HubSpot?
<@U01EWNNK563> Maybe the onetrust support will be more valuable on this subject but explain me what’s your issue
So our client wants to use OneTrust instead of the default OneTrust integration, I’m just having some trouble with OneTrust disabling the HubSpot cookies if they select `strictly necessary cookies`
Thanks <@U01DF3PNCKA>
so you want to implement onetrust on the cms part of HubSpot ?

```HubSpot.configure do |config|
  # Configure API key authorization: hapikey
  config.api_key['hapikey'] = 'demo'
end

# Get contacts
basic_api = HubSpot::Crm::Contacts::BasicApi.new
basic_api.get_page(auth_names: 'hapikey')```
Hello, Pleae I am trying to integrate the HubSpot ruby client, but I can’t find a good explanation for the above snippet in the documentation. Can anyone help with that ?
Correct, I can obviously get the cookie policy to pop up and ask for the users consent it just doesn’t really do anything after that.

You have to replace ‘demo’ in line 3 by your apiKey

Line 7 it create a HubSpot crm contact api wrapper
Line 8 Get a page of contact

But i don’“t know well the ruby client

First thing , you are not on the good place it’s not an api question. You should first check in <https://community.HubSpot.com/> if someone already ask the question, and if not create a new issue.. My knowledge area is on api on code
And call the onetrust support i’m sure they know well how to integrate their own product, it  should be the better solution
Ok, thanks Quentin.
Thanks but I feel that’s if you’re communicating using the APIKey and not using something like OAuth.
Hi guys, anyone is using R to do data analysis with HubSpot? Do you have any R packages recommend to pull the data from HubSpot?

Hello All! I was wondering if anyone could help me I am wanting to create a  data capture in my HubSpot account that will capture any changes in the users account for example if you were an existing user and you make a change to your subscription like switching from a freemium to a paid account and have that information would get sent to our API from HubSpot. I am wondering if anyone has any tips on how to do that? Like an Automated customer account update Push to API. Would the best way to do this be adding a webhook?
